title: OpenAI Reaches A.I. Agreement With Defense Dept. After Anthropic Clash
summary: The deal came hours after President Trump had ordered federal agencies to stop using artificial intelligence technology made by Anthropic, an OpenAI rival.

title: Trump Orders U.S. Agencies to Stop Using Anthropic AI Tech After Pentagon Standoff
summary: The company had clashed with the military over how officials wanted to use its cutting-edge A.I. model. The order could vastly complicate intelligence analysis and defense work.

title: Pentagon-Anthropic Standoff Is a Decisive Moment for How A.I. Will Be Used in War
summary: The Pentagon’s contract dispute with Anthropic is part of a wider clash about the use of artificial intelligence for national security and who decides on any safeguards.

title: Silicon Valley Rallies Behind Anthropic in A.I. Clash With Trump
summary: Actions by the president and the Pentagon appeared to drive a wedge between Washington and the tech industry, whose leaders and workers spoke out for the start-up.

title: Bill Clinton Testifies He ‘Saw Nothing’ of Epstein’s Misdeeds
summary: The former president sat for hours of questioning by members of both parties, in an appearance that Democrats signaled they would use as a precedent to force President Trump to do the same.

title: L.A.U.S.D. Chief Alberto Carvalho Is Placed on Leave Following F.B.I. Raid
summary: Alberto Carvalho, superintendent of the Los Angeles Unified School District, was placed on paid leave after F.B.I. agents raided his home and district office this week.

title: Trump ‘Not Happy’ With Iran Talks, but Says He Remains Undecided on Strikes
summary: President Trump said he had not made a final decision about whether to order military action against Iran.

title: Inside the USS Ford, the Navy’s Newest Aircraft Carrier, as It Heads to Mideast
summary: The carrier has had mechanical problems throughout its eight-month deployment, but officials now say it is ready for battle. Take a look inside the ship.

title: Iran’s Students Are Protesting Again. Here’s Why.
summary: The unrest underlines the intensity of domestic discontent, even as Tehran’s government grapples with the threat of U.S. strikes. Here’s what to know.

title: A Trump Call Ignited Saudi-U.A.E. Feud
summary: A request made to President Trump about the war in Sudan is at the heart of a diplomatic dispute between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.

title: Neil Sedaka, Singing Craftsman of Memorable Pop Songs, Dies at 86
summary: He sang and co-wrote some of the definitive teenage anthems of the 1950s and early ’60s, including “Breaking Up Is Hard to Do,” and then reinvented his career in the ’70s.

title: Neil Sedaka: 14 Essential Songs
summary: The singer and songwriter, who died on Friday at 86, gave voice to teenage dreams, then executed one of music’s most unexpected comebacks.

title: Kamala Harris Endorses Jasmine Crockett in Texas Senate Race
summary: The endorsement from the former vice president, her most significant since leaving office, comes as Ms. Crockett is facing a competitive Democratic primary contest against James Talarico.

title: ‘We Got to Win the Midterms’: Trump Takes His State of the Union Message on the Road
summary: During a visit to Texas, President Trump made clear that he would be driving home his depiction of Democrats as out of step ahead of the elections in November.

title: In Tuesday’s North Carolina Primaries, the Left Is Aiming for Democrats
summary: From a Durham-area House race to three statehouse races, North Carolina liberals are signaling that their tolerance for Democratic stalwarts may be coming to an end.

title: Student Remains in Honduras After ICE Vows to Deport Her Again
summary: Any Lucia López Belloza was deported by mistake. A judge ordered her return by Friday. When the Trump administration sent a plane, she decided not to get on.

title: Columbia Student Detained by ICE Promotes ‘Beauty’ and ‘Brains’ Online
summary: Elmina Aghayeva has 114,000 followers on Instagram and has seemingly never posted about politics, unlike other Columbia University students detained by immigration officers.

title: Border Patrol Left a Refugee at a Cafe. Days Later, He Was Found Dead.
summary: The disabled man had been released from jail when federal officers showed up and drove him to a coffee shop. His family searched for him for days.

title: 30 More Indicted in Cities Church Protest Against ICE in St. Paul
summary: The newly indicted people join nine others, including Don Lemon, in facing charges in connection to a protest of President Trump’s immigration crackdown during a worship service.

title: Carney Visiting India, Australia and Japan to Build Canada’s ‘Middle Power’ Bonds
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney visits India, Australia and Japan seeking deals to strengthen his country’s links to Indo-Pacific powers and break Canada’s dependence on the United States.

title: In a Memoir Draft, Changpeng Zhao of Binance Details the Talks Leading to His Prison Time
summary: In a draft of his memoir, Changpeng Zhao, the founder of Binance, laid out the secret negotiations that led to his imprisonment and a run-in with ICE.

title: How David Zaslav Pulled Off the Sale of Warner Bros. Discovery to Paramount
summary: Not long ago, Mr. Zaslav was widely criticized for his management of Warner Bros. Discovery. He overcame the doubters, cementing a blockbuster sale to Paramount.

title: Henrietta Lacks’s Family Settles Suit With Novartis Over Use of Her Cells
summary: Ms. Lacks’s family accused Novartis of profiting from her cells, which were taken from her without her consent in 1951, when she was dying of cervical cancer.

title: Fewer Detectives Will Hunt for Nancy Guthrie, Signaling a New Phase
summary: After a month with little visible progress, the sheriff in Pima County, Ariz., is sending some deputies back to their regular units.

title: Justice Thomas Bemoans Incivility as Security Prompts Cancellation of In-Person Speech
summary: The justice participated remotely in a closed-door session of a legal conference, a reminder of the heightened threats facing jurists in recent years.

title: The Rise and Fall of a 3-D Printing Empire
summary: Desktop Metal, a billion-dollar start-up, promised to revolutionize manufacturing. It went bankrupt, and now has much humbler ambitions as the 3-D printing industry takes a sober turn.

title: I Needed ‘Heated Rivalry’: Gay Romance Minus the Tragedy
summary: After a lifetime of settling for shame, secrecy and death onscreen, I had my doubts about “Heated Rivalry.” Then it seduced me, too.

title: The Pentagon Can’t Afford This Fight
summary: The military needs the very best A.I. to streamline its operations. It should find ways to work with these companies, not erect barriers.

title: How Israel Lost Americans
summary: Netanyahu and his government deserve the growing bipartisan opprobrium they’re receiving.

title: Instagram to Alert Parents to Teens’ Self-Harm Searches
summary: Parents will receive notifications if a child has used the platform repeatedly to search for terms related to suicide or self-harm, but users must opt in to get them.

title: An Update: Did a Brooklyn Couple Kill a Neighbor’s Trees for a Better View in Maine?
summary: On Friday, the state approved a settlement that included a $3,000 fine but no acknowledgment of guilt for a tree poisoning that riled people in scenic Rockport, Maine.

title: Judge Approves $345 Million Verdict Against Greenpeace in Dakota Access Pipeline Suit
summary: Greenpeace has said the verdict could bankrupt it. The lawsuit was over the group’s role in protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline.

title: Former U.S. Air Force Officer Is Accused of Training Chinese Military Pilots
summary: The former officer traveled to China to train pilots of the People’s Liberation Army Air Force without approval from the State Department, the Justice Department said.
